summary: This is an email chain from July 27, 2019, discussing plans to secure and execute a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas. The email details coordination between law enforcement agencies, references a prior search of Epstein's NYC residence, and mentions the desire to isolate the current case from the investigation 12 years prior.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses securing a search warrant for his private island near St. Thomas as part of an ongoing investigation.

events.title: Discussion about island search warrant
events.description: Law enforcement officials discussed plans to secure a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island.

events.title: Email coordination for island search
events.description: An email chain details ongoing coordination to secure and plan the execution of a search warrant for Epstein's island, with an expectation it will happen within the next 30 days.

events.title: Reference to NYC residence search
events.description: The email references a prior search of Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence, where initial scope was limited but expanded upon observation of evidence, resulting in 845 pictures taken over 13 hours.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's island near St. Thomas
keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively planning a 'substantial' search operation for Jeffrey Epstein's private island near St. Thomas in late July 2019.
The warrant for the island was anticipated to be for a full search, unlike the initial limited warrant for Epstein's NYC residence.
A prior search of Epstein's NYC residence initially sought only pictures and proof of residency but expanded, resulting in 845 photos taken over 13 hours.
The email indicates an effort to isolate the 2019 case from the investigation into Epstein that occurred approximately 12 years prior.
Coordination involved multiple law enforcement partners including CBP (Customs and Border Protection) and USCG (U.S. Coast Guard).
